instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad doesn't track
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in as no power. Replaced <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> and power was restored.
Intermittent keyboard and trackpad only clicked, didn't track. Light on MagSafe would be green for 10 sec, then off for a few sec, then back to green.
Replaced <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> and keyboard is now 100%, MagSafe LED also acts normal now. Still no tracking on the trackpad though. USB keyboard/mouse also intermittently didn't work,
Finally replaced <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> as I get 0V on <RESISTOR>R5702</RESISTOR>. USB is now acting normal but this made no difference for the trackpad. tested with two other trackpads that show the same issue.

Not sure where to take it from here.
Board did not suffer liquid damage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad doesn't track
threads.message: Diode mode on all pins of trackpad connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad doesn't track
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad doesn't track
threads.message: Pin 19 should be about the same as pin 17, check for corroded trace...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad doesn't track
threads.message: Pin 19 has nothing to do with the trackpad working or not, it is for thermal sensor, should be fixed though. Pin 18 is a big problem as there should be something there. Corroded trace to <RESISTOR>R5800</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5800</RESISTOR> fucked, etc.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad doesn't track
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R5806</RESISTOR> torn off by fingernail is most likely. It is right on the corner.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad doesn't track
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5806</RESISTOR> is present.

No <RESISTOR>R5800</RESISTOR> on this board but checked L5800 and <CAPACITOR>C5800</CAPACITOR> (assuming you made a typo) and those are not on the board. According to schematic they should be there? It doesn't mention OMIT or NOSTUFF but the pads have not been used, checked a few donor boards and they don't have those components either. No tin, scrapes or pits, just unused gold contacts.

I do get 5V where those components should be according to schematic. If none of the donor boards have them either I'm assuming the schematic is wrong here, what do you think?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad doesn't track
threads.message: Oh yeah they are indeed "no stuff". Do you have 18V on <RESISTOR>R5806</RESISTOR>, trackpad must be connected when checking.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad doesn't track
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad doesn't track
threads.message: There is the problem. You did check with a trackpad connected? Check <SIGNAL>Z2_BOOST_EN</SIGNAL> and power to <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad doesn't track
threads.message:
Yessir, trackpad was connected.
Power to <CHIP>U5805</CHIP> 5.1V (pin 2),  <SIGNAL>Z2_BOOST_EN</SIGNAL> 3.3V (pin 5)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad doesn't track
threads.message: Well, then there must be an issue with <CHIP>U5805</CHIP> or something around it.
